page.title: 01BEMPTON AND BUCKTON
page.content: Bempton and Buckton are situated on the {Flamborough}headland. With the exception of the residential sectors, the landscape is almost entirely given over to agriculture. As a selected settlement in the { {Humberside}County Council Structure Plan, Bempton is expanding whereas Buckton is a non-selected village therefore no major development can take place. The two villages are administered by one Parish Council based at Bempton. The villages, which are separated by only one field, are situated in a valley with the land to the north rising to form spectacular { chalk {cliffs}and the land to the south rising before dropping down towards {Bridlington.}
